}} 'Jacob Derwig' (born 15 July 1969) is a Dutch film and television actor.

In 2003 he married actress Kim van Kooten; they have a son Roman (born 2004) and
a daughter Kee Molly (born 2007). Derwig has been part of the ensemble of Dutch
theatre company Toneelgroep Amsterdam since 2005. For his part in their
production Naar Damascus in 2008 he was nominated for a Louis d'Or, and in 2006
he was nominated for an Arlecchino (best supporting actor) for Opening Night. In
2008 he received the Paul Steenbergen-penning from Pierre Bokma.

Before signing with Toneelgroep Amsterdam, Derwig played with 't Barre Land
and De Trust (1995-1999). There he played, amongst others, the title role in
the acclaimed production of [[Hamlet]], which earned him a nomination for a
Louis d'Or.
